result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Obediah R Hardy-Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Obediah R Hardy-Brown in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Plea Hearing. 
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations with cases 14CM4404 & 14CM4662, the court ordered case Dismissed, but read in for purposes of sentencing. 
Court further ordered bail transfered to case 14CM4404.

Motion for modification of bail proceeded.  Court allows release from GPS monitoring for defendant to conduct whatever business needs to be done regarding his SSD benefits if Justice Point is notified in advance.

Defendant Obediah R Hardy-Brown in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Global offer needed for all of defendant's cases.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Obediah R Hardy-Brown NOT in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT in court, case not scheduled for court today. FILE NOT IN COURT. ADA FILE NOT IN COURT. Defense requested court hear matter to address GPS supervision conditions, state did not object. Defense requested additional release to allow defendant to attend a funeral of a relative, state did not object. Court allowed defendant release from 24 HOUR curfew from 9:30 AM until 2:00 PM, defendant may only be at the location of the funeral/visitation or interment. Defendant must provide Justice Point location information in advance. All other conditions of bail remain in effect. Case remains scheduled for Status Conference on 4/30/2015 at 1:30 PM.

15RM017599  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04-04-15

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Obediah R Hardy-Brown in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Obediah R Hardy-Brown in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised that due to lower pending cases this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Obediah R Hardy-Brown
Current: 2208 N 22nd Street, #5, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 04-04-2015)
Prior: 2208 West Locust Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
